org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: The justice having opened court, the names of the witnesses were called out, and as the persons came in they were sent to the witness; room. H. B. Lockwood, a brother of M. Lockwood, deceased, a seat near the prosecuting attorney.
The first witness called was A.H. Thompson, who was sworn, and in answer to interrogatories of the prosecuting attorney, testified as follows:

I live in Tacoma, and have resided here since last August; am night yardmaster; between 2 and 3 o'clock on the morning of the 16th, I was on a train between the wharf and the top of the hill; after 2 o'clock we were going up the grade, with a car of live stock for the slaughterhouse; I was sitting in the engine cab, on the fireman's side, which is on this side of track; saw an object moving on left of track, and moving away from a black object; I thought the latter was an overcoat; I kept my eyes on the object, until, when the fireman opened the firebox door, the fire blinded me and prevented me from seeing; the engine
